Package rummy

Class Game

java.lang.Object
rummy.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
This class generates a game and makes the game playable.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Brandon Staton, Dillon Kilroy, Nikunj Patel

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Game()
    The constructor initiates the game

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      This function resets the game if two things happen: 1. If a player has no more cards in his hand, or 2. If the deck is empty When the reset happens: Players turn in all their cards in hand, laid down cards and all the discarded cards are collected. The only thing that stays the same is players' scores.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • checkMatchRun

      public boolean checkMatchRun​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This function checks if the given cards are a possible run
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand to be checked for a potential run
      Returns:
      True if there is a run, false otherwise.

    • checkSuitRun

      public boolean checkSuitRun​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This function specifically checks for a Suit run.
      Parameters:
      hand - The cards which are checked to see if there is a possible run.
      Returns:
      True if there is a possible run, false otherwise.

    • isRun

      public boolean isRun​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This functions makes sure that the cards picked up by the player from the discard pile make a run. If there is no possible run from the cards picked up from the discard pile and the cards in players hand than the function returns false, true otherwise.
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand of the player with chosen cards from the discard pile
      Returns:
      True if the hand makes a successful run, false otherwise.

    • sortHand

      public void sortHand​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This function sorts the hand
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand which is to be sorted.

    • discard

      public void discard​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This function lets the player discard a card.
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand from which a card is to be discarded.

    • draw

      public void draw​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
      This function lets the player draw a card from the deck.
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand in which the drawn card will be added.

      public void drawFromDiscard​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand)
